Data_Description: Unique serial number for the customer's device (e.g., RKISBDI40368318).
Type of device provided to the customer, typically a set-top box (STB) in this context.
Date and time when the customer's service was activated (e.g., 08/12/21).
Indicates whether the customer's account is paid (e.g., 'paid', 'migrated').
Unique identifier for the offer given to the customer.
Unique identifier for each customer.
Name of the city where the customer resides (e.g., Jaipur City, Delhi East).
Administrative district of the city (e.g., Jaipur, East).
State where the city is located (e.g., RJ for Rajasthan, DL for Delhi).
Unique identifier for the Jio center associated with the customer (e.g., I265).
Installation city for the service (same as crm_city in many cases).
Installation district for the service (same as crm_district in many cases).
Installation state for the service (same as crm_state in many cases).
Unique identifier for the Jio center where the service was installed.
Circle identifier within the telecom network (e.g., RJ, DL).
Status of the product associated with the customer (e.g., '1.0' for an active product).
Date and time when the product was activated (e.g., 2021-12-09T13:28:30.000+05:30).
Customer category, likely a numeric code representing different customer types.
Date and time when the customer's record was created in the system.
Date and time of the appointment for service activation.
Unique identifier for the customer's service.
Another unique identifier, potentially redundant with customer_service_id.
Unique identifier for the voice service associated with the customer.
Type of service provided (e.g., Z0005 for a specific service type).
Date and time when the service details were last modified.
Mobile Subscriber Integrated Services Digital Network (MSISDN) number, unique to each mobile device (e.g., 778700000000).
International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI) number, unique to each mobile device (e.g., 778700000000).
Name of the product or service provided to the customer (e.g., FTTH for Fiber To The Home).
Indicates whether the customer was onboarded manually (True/False).
Type of product subscribed by the customer (e.g., FTTH).
Represents the date and time when the customer's account was created. Example: 09/12/21
Indicates the date and time when the product was activated for the customer. Example: 2023-05-04T00:00:00
The date and time of the last transaction for the customer. Example: 2023-04-30T14:32:28.000+05:30
Unique identifier for the customer's plan. Example: 1014275
Name of the customer's plan, typically describing the type and features of the plan. Example: 399+200(14 OTT) 6M
Type of the plan, such as BASEPLAN/POSTPAID. Example: BASEPLAN/POSTPAID
Date and time of the latest recharge for the customer. Example: 2023-04-22T14:18:32.000+05:30
Expiry date of the customer's latest recharge. Example: 2024-07-26T00:00:00.000+05:30
Status of the customer's plan, such as active or expired. Example: active
Identifier for the building where the customer's services are provided. Example: JPURBD0326568
Unique Identifier for the SAP system entry in the customer's record. Example: I-RJ-JPUR-UJP-0001
State where the customer's services are provided (4G). Example: Rajasthan
City where the customer's services are provided. Example: Jaipur
Code identifying the Jio Centre associated with the customer's services. Example: I-RJ-JPUR-JCO-0001
FSA (Forward Sortation Area) ID for the customer's location. Example: JPUR0159
Category of the building based on its type, size, and other characteristics. Example: RSTOTKHB0057652
Serial number of the Optical Network Terminal (ONT) associated with the customer's services. Example: RSVOTAJEM116307
Details of the Optical Line Terminal (OLT) port connected to the ONT. Example: LT-1/SLOT-15/SFPPON-15/Channel-6
Network Element Identifier for the OLT. Example: INRJJPURRMNGTW0002ENBOLT001
Network Element Identifier of the East side neighbor. Example: INRJJPURMTNRCR0001MA2AAR001
Network Element Identifier of the West side neighbor. Example: INRJJPURGAJNNB0001MA2AAR001
Details of the second-stage outport. Example: OUT-1
Network Element Identifier of the second-stage network element. Example: INRJJPURRMNGPL0381FTXSP2001
Details of the first-stage outport. Example: OUT-7
Network Element Identifier of the first-stage network element. Example: INRJJPURRMNGPL0099FTXSP1001
Date and time when the ONT Customer Premises Equipment (CPE) was last updated. Example: 2024-06-28T13:13:11.000+05:30
A flag or timestamp indicating whether the ONT's flag was updated or created. Example: 2.0
Model of the ONT. Example: JCOW404
Name of the manufacturer of the ONT's PCG (Power Control Gateway). Example: Sercomm
Product name of the ONT. Example: SRCMTF1_JCOW404_R2.30.1
Unique serial number of the ACS Optical Distribution Unit (ODU), used to identify specific hardware devices.
Date when the ACS ODU software was last updated, represented as a textual string.
Product name or model of the ACS ODU, providing specifics about the device type.
Name of the manufacturer of the Personal Computer Group (PCG) component within the ACS ODU.
Model number or identifier for the ACS ODU, indicating the specific version or model of the device.
Flag indicating whether the ACS ODU record was updated or created, typically a text value like "U" for updated or "C" for created.
Unique serial number of the Digital Cable Set Top Box (STB), used to identify specific set top box devices.
Duration in minutes for which a specific app was used on the STB, including fractional minutes.
Name of the application used on the STB, such as "Hotstar," "JioCinema," or "Netflix."
Numeric code representing the version of the application used, typically used for version control and updates.
Version number of the ADC library used in the STB, aiding in software compatibility and functionality.
Version number of the host application running on the STB, similar to the ADC library version but specific to the host app.
Name of the ADC library version used, providing a descriptive version identifier.
Time bucket representing the hour during which the application was used, derived from the event date and time.
Date of the event recorded for the STB usage, formatted as "dd/mm/yy."
Model of the ACS STB, indicating the specific type or version of the set top box.
Name of the manufacturer of the PCG component within the ACS STB.
Product name or model of the ACS STB, providing specifics about the device type.
Package name of the application used on the STB, such as "com.jio.media.stb.ondemand" or "com.netflix.ninja."
Date when the data record was inserted into the database, formatted as "dd/mm/yy."
Name of the Over-The-Top (OTT) application used on the STB, such as "Hotstar," "JioCinema," or "Netflix."
Flag indicating whether the system application is active or not, with possible values 'yes' or 'no'.
Flag indicating whether the old system application is active or not, with possible values 'yes' or 'no'.
Model of the Digital Cable (DC) STB, providing specifics about the device type.
Minutes of Usage (MOU) for the 0-1 hour bucket, representing the time spent on the app within this time segment.
Minutes of Usage (MOU) for the 1-2 hour bucket, representing the time spent on the app within this time segment.
Minutes of Usage (MOU) for the 2-3 hour bucket, representing the time spent on the app within this time segment.
Minutes of Usage (MOU) for the 3-4 hour bucket, representing the time spent on the app within this time segment.
Minutes of Usage (MOU) for the 4-5 hour bucket, representing the time spent on the app within this time segment.
Minutes of Usage (MOU) for the 5-6 hour bucket, representing the time spent on the app within this time segment.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 6:00 and 7:00 AM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.5333333333333333, 0.1666666666666666.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 7:00 and 8:00 AM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.0, 0.0.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 8:00 and 9:00 AM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.0, 0.0.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 9:00 and 10:00 AM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.0, 0.0.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 10:00 and 11:00 AM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.0, 0.0.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 11:00 and 12:00 PM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.0, 0.0.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 12:00 and 1:00 PM. Sample values include 0.1666666666666666, 0.0, 0.0.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 1:00 and 2:00 PM. Sample values include 0.5333333333333333, 0.1166666666666666, 0.0.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 2:00 and 3:00 PM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.0, 2.983333333333333.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 3:00 and 4:00 PM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.0, 0.0.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 4:00 and 5:00 PM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.0, 19.716666666666665.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 5:00 and 6:00 PM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.0, 0.0.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 6:00 and 7:00 PM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.066666667, 12.183333333333334.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 7:00 and 8:00 PM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.0, 0.0.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 8:00 and 9:00 PM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.0, 0.0.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 9:00 and 10:00 PM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.0, 0.0.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 10:00 and 11:00 PM. Sample values include 0.0, 0.0, 0.0.
Represents the average minutes of use (MOU) for calls or usage between 11:00 PM and midnight. Sample values include 0, 0.5, 0.0.

Represents the application package or software package identifier. It is a string that uniquely identifies an application or package. Sample values include "in.startv.hotstar", "com.jio.media.stb.ondemand".
Represents a geographic or location identifier possibly linked to the telecom services provided. It is a string that helps in identifying the location or region. Sample values include "", "".
Represents the date on which the data was partitioned or segmented. It is in the format 'dd/mm/yy'. Sample values include '29/06/24'.
